title: Unfinished Study of Sheep

thumbnail.alt_text: Painting in brown and yellow tones of a flock of sheep at close range, one facing front and looking directly at the viewer.

exhibition_history: Tokyo, The Seibu Museum, Millet, Corot and the School of Barbizon, March 15–April 14, 1980, cat. T. 59; travelled to Kobe, Japan, The Museum of Modern Art, Hyogo, April 19–May 18, 1980; Sapporo, The Hokkaido Museum of Modern Art, May 24–June 15, 1980; The Hiroshima Prefectural Museum, June 2–July 13, 1980; Kitakyushu Municipal Museum, July 19–August 10, 1980.
provenance_text: Henry Field (died 1890), Chicago; his widow Mrs. Florence Lathrop Field; given to the Art Institute, 1894.
